articles.title: Kim Jong Un Inspects Posts on Mt. Osong and KPA Unit 507
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Inspects Posts on Mt. Osong and KPA Unit 507 
						
 Pyongyang, June 2 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Marshal Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, inspected KPA posts defending Mt. Osong and KPA Unit 507 on Sunday.
					 He was accompanied by KPA General Kim Kyok Sik, chief of the KPA General Staff, KPA Col. Gen. Pak Jong Chon, Lieut. Gen. An Ji Yong, Choe Hwi, first vice department director of the WPK Central Committee and Pak Thae Song, vice department director of the WPK Central Committee.
					
					 After receiving a salute from the commander of KPA Large Combined Unit 549, he looked round the monument to the field guidance erected to hand down to posterity the Songun leadership exploits performed by leader Kim Jong Il before dropping in at its forward command post.
					
					 He was briefed in detail on the positions and movements of the enemy troops with which the unit is standing in confrontation and learned in detail about topography there.
					
					 Receiving a report on the duty of the unit and the situation, he expressed great satisfaction over the fact that it assigned operational and combat duties in line with the intention of the Supreme Command and is always keeping itself fully combat ready.
					
					 Stressing the need for the commanding officers and men of the unit to firmly prepare themselves politically and ideologically and in military technique to beat back any enemy's invasion at a single strike, he gave them precious instructions to do so.
					
					 He looked round the watch post of KPA unit 785.
					
					  He learned about the performance of duty by a serviceman on guard duty.
					
					 He dropped in at the bedroom of the platoon defending the watch post and met with its service personnel.
					
					 He said he was pleased to meet service personnel on Mt. Osong, adding he wished to see them. 
					
					 He gave the platoon a pair of binoculars and an automatic rifle as gifts and had a picture taken with them.
					
					 He went round the bedroom, education room and mess hall of the Third Company of the First Battalion under KPA Unit 565 to pay deep attention to the living of service personnel.
					
					 He gave the company a pair of binoculars, au automatic rifle and a machine gun as gifts and had a photo session with service personnel.
					
					 Kim Jong Il lived, always thinking of the service personnel of Mt. Osong, Kim Jong Un said, adding he visited there, carrying with him this feeling. He told them to stand by his side one by one before having a photo taken with them.
					
					 He reposed the deepest trust in them, saying that the people sleep in peace and the Supreme Commander feels reassured as the sentinels on the forefront are defending the gate to the country as firm as an iron wall.
					
					Then he visited the post on Kkachil Peak. 
					
					 He told the soldiers there as follows:
					
					"There is a road to your hometown behind you where your beloved parents, brothers and sisters live. Always remember this. This is not a far-flung post at all. Your Supreme Commander is always with you. I'll frequently visit Mt. Osong."
					
					 He had a photo session with the soldiers, having them in his arms.
					
					 He visited the Command of KPA Unit 507.
					
					After receiving a salute, he dropped in at the operation study room where he received a report on the unit's performance of duty and trainings.
					
					 Noting the mission of the unit is very important, he indicated important tasks which would serve as guidelines for the unit in rounding off its combat preparations.
					
					 Mt. Osong and Chol Pass are witnesses and symbols of Songun revolutionary leadership, he said.
					
					 Expressing expectation and belief that the service personnel of the unit would reliably defend the forefront post of the socialist homeland, he had a photo session with them.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Pig Farm under KPA Unit 549
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Pig Farm under KPA Unit 549
						
 Pyongyang, June 2 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Marshal Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of  Korea and first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, visited a pig farm under KPA Unit 549.
					 The pig farm was built according to the instruction given by leader Kim Jong Il on May 8, 2006, prompted by his strong desire to provide more meat to the service persons.
					
					 Kim Jong Un acquainted himself with the management and operation of the farm.
					
					 He learnt in detail about the production capacity of the farm, the quantity of pork produced last year and the measures taken by the farm to ensure the supply of electricity and feed. He asked about how the farm has carried out the instruction given by Kim Jong Il to produce electricity by use of methane gas generated from excrement of pigs.
					
					 Kim Jong Il, who personally initiated the building of the farm and clearly indicated the road to be followed by it, said he would visit the farm once in his lifetime but he failed to do so, Kim Jong Un noted.
					
					 He went round fattening house No.1, a piglet house, a breeding house, a feed processing factory, a meat processing factory and a combined control room to learn about the raising and tending of pigs and the pork processing at the farm.  
					
					 At the fattening house he was pleased to see a herd of fat pigs and asked how many pigs are bred in a house, what is the feed supply norm and what is the per hectare grain yield at the farms supplying feed to the pig farm. 
					
					 At the piglet house, he asked about the death rate of pigs. At the breeding house, he was satisfied with good strains, underscoring the importance of taking good measures for ensuring proper temperature in breeding pigs and establishing a good ventilation system.
					
					 Underlining the need to put pig breeding on a scientific basis, he said it is necessary for the farm to build well a research institute for settling scientific and technological issues arising in breeding and veterinary and anti-epizootic work and enhance its function and role. 
					
					 He dropped in at the feed processing factory to examine organic compound fertilizer, additives, preventive medicines, etc. produced by the farm and learn about the feed processing.
					
					 In order to settle the feed issue, it is necessary to simultaneously develop stock-breeding and agriculture, he noted, stressing the need for the farm to keep the production of organic compound fertilizer going at a high rate and send more fertilizers to relevant farms.
					
					 As Kim Jong Il stressed on every occasion, it is possible to simultaneously increase pork production and grain yield only when a cyclic production system is fully introduced to stock-breeding and agriculture, he said.
					
					 Making a round of the meat processing factory, he underscored the need to put it on a high level of automation and mass-produce varieties of quality processed pork including sausages and send them to service personnel.
					
					  At the combined control room he underlined the need to arrange overall production processes to more rationally suit breeding and energetically push ahead with the work for placing pork production on a scientific and intensive basis as required by the new century.
					
					 He expressed expectation and belief that the officials and employees of the pig farm would work harder true to the WPK's policy for stock-breeding, produce greater quantities of pork and processed meat and send them to service personnel before having a photo session with them.
					
					 He was accompanied by KPA Col. Gen. Pak Jong Chon, KPA Lieut. Gen. An Ji Yong, First Vice Department Director of the C.C., WPK Choe Hwi and Vice Department Director of the C.C., WPK Pak Thae Song.

articles.title: Premier Makes Field Survey of Second-phase Construction of Huichon Power Station
articles.content:
Premier Makes Field Survey of Second-phase Construction of Huichon Power Station
 Pyongyang, June 2 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju made a field survey of the second-phase construction of the Huichon Power Station (power station in tiers on the River Chongchon).
					 Going round various places of the construction site, he encouraged the builders in the drive to make innovations in the construction of the power station, true to the grand nature-remaking plan of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Underlining the need to increase electricity production as modern industrial establishments are appearing one after another to contribute to developing the economy and improving the standard of people's living under the wise leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea, he said that the construction of the power station should be completed as planned.
					
					 The consultative meeting held on the spot stressed the need for officials and builders to increase the speed of the project and ensure the quality of construction on the highest level by learning from the work style of the Korean People's Army devotedly implementing the party's line and policies.
					
					 It called on ministries, national institutions and relevant units to supply needed materials in good time.
					
					 Earlier, the premier went round the projects for remodeling the Pyongyang Indoor Stadium and the People's Palace of Culture.
					
					 To successfully remodel them is an important work for glorifying the immortal leadership feats of the peerlessly great persons, he said, discussing measures for facilitating the projects.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Kim Jong Il's Exploits in Developing DPRK-China Friendship
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Kim Jong Il's Exploits in Developing DPRK-China Friendship
 Pyongyang, June 2 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il conducted energetic external activities by making a 6 250 km-long journey to China by train from June 1 to 13, Juche 72 (1983).
					 Rodong Sinmun Sunday dedicates an editorial to the 30th anniversary of his historic maiden visit to China.
					
					 The visit, his first foreign tour, marked a historic event of great significance in boosting the DPRK-China down through generations, the editorial says, and goes on:
					
					 The 30 year-long history since this visit indicates that the DPRK-China friendship is an unbreakable one.
					
					 During his visit to China he said that the traditional relations of friendship between the two parties and peoples should be carried forward down through generations as the revolutionary struggle of the two peoples continues generation after generation, clarifying the fixed position of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) that the Korean people will stand by the side of the Chinese people forever in carrying out the common cause of building socialism against imperialism.
					
					 He visited China eight times in the 2000s.
					
					 Remarkable successes have been achieved in socialist construction of China.
					
					 The Korean people sincerely hope the Chinese people would register greater progress in the struggle to build a comprehensively well-off society by embodying the spirit of the 18th Congress of the Communist Party of China in all fields and successfully attaining the grand target of economic construction under the 12th Five-Year Plan.
					
					 It is the earnest behests of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il to boost the DPRK-China friendship generation after generation.
					
					 The dear respected Kim Jong Un is paying deep attention to developing the DPRK-China friendship, true to the noble intention of the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Kim Jong Un sent his special envoy to China recently who conveyed his personal letter to Xi Jinping, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China.
					
					 The WPK and the Korean people will in the future, too, make positive efforts to boost the bonds of the DPRK-China friendship, which stood the test of history,  as desired by Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Remaining True to June 15 Joint Declaration
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Remaining True to June 15 Joint Declaration
						
 Pyongyang, June 2 (KCNA) -- The north and the south of Korea had a summit, the first of its kind in the history of the nation's division, and adopted the north-south joint declaration on June 15, Juche 89 (2000). The June 15 joint declaration comprehensively indicates the principle and ways of reunifying the country independently and peacefully, guided by the idea of "By our nation itself".
					 Rodong Sinmun Sunday in a bylined article says the June 15 joint declaration serves as an immortal banner of independent reunification whose validity and vitality the Korean nation has keenly realized in practice.
					
					 The article goes on:
					
					 The June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration should be certainly respected and implemented as they are programmes for reunification common to the nation, the only ones acceptable to the Koreans in the north and the south despite their differing ideologies and social systems.
					
					 All the Koreans desirous of improved inter-Korean relations and peace and reunification of the country should positively support the north-south declarations, attaching greatest importance to them, and make every possible effort to promote reconciliation, solidarity and alliance under the banner of "By our nation itself".
					
					 It is inevitable that the inter-Korean relations will be plunged into a catastrophe if the joint declarations are not respected and implemented. This is evidenced by the five year-long rule of traitor Lee Myung Bak ill-famed for confrontation against reunification.
					
					 The stand and attitude toward the joint declarations are a litmus test of dialogue and confrontation, peace and war, reunification and division.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should face up to the aspiration of fellow countrymen and the trend of the times and abandon the anachronistic concept of confrontation.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Hit for Its Moves to Purchase American Weapons
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Hit for Moves to Purchase American Weapons
						
 Pyongyang, June 2 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification in south Korea held the 134th meeting for peace and disarmament on May 30 denouncing the puppet authorities for trying to purchase more American weapons for aggression.
					 At the meeting speakers recalled that some days ago rulers of south Korea and the U.S. were closeted to agree upon the issue of "increasing the defense capability whose mutual operation is possible".
					
					 The mutual operation is the phraseology used by the U.S. whenever it sells its weapons to south Korea and this was once exposed by a website, they noted.
					
					 Under this pretext the U.S. is now contemplating selling its new type fighters to south Korea, and the south Korean authorities are stepping up building of the mutual coordination system between their operation control center aimed at introducing SM-3 missiles and detecting missiles and the U.S. operation control center, they said.
					
					 They urged the authorities to stop at once the moves to purchase American weapons and join in the U.S missile defense system.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime Accused of Misleading Public Opinion
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime Accused of Misleading Public Opinion
						
 Pyongyang, June 2 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions held a press conference in Seoul on May 30 denouncing the puppet regime for misleading public opinion.
					 At the conference speakers recalled that on the same day the authorities announced the so-called "worker-company-government convention on jobs to ensure 70 percent employment rate" which they worked out in league with the Federation of Businessmen and the Federation of Trade Unions.
					
					 This convention is nothing but a political advertisement prepared 100 days since the present chief executive's taking office, they charged.
					
					 The convention did not refer to the major labor issues including those of the Government Employees Union, Teachers Trade Union and Ssangyong Motors and the reckless remarks of the chief executive, they held.
					
					 Intolerable is the attitude of the authorities seeking to make a retrogressive revision of the wage system and increase job opportunities with low wages, they charged.
					
					 Noting that the authorities' announcement of the convention on jobs is no more than a prearranged scenario, they declared null and void the closed-door convention which put forward the Federation of Trade Unions as a shield and excluded the Confederation of Trade Unions representing workers.
					
					 They urged the authorities to opt for ensuring the basic rights of workers and settling the labor issues.
					
					 They vowed to lay bare the irrationality of the authorities' labor policy from June 4 and escalate their actions with this as a momentum.

articles.title: S. Korean Conservatives Accused of Tampering with History
articles.content:
S. Korean Conservatives Accused of Tampering with History 
						
 Pyongyang, June 2 (KCNA) -- The conservative group in south Korea is working with bloodshot eyes to distort history, according to the south Korean paper Kyunghyang Daily News on Friday. 
					 Shortly ago, the puppet Committee for Compiling National History in south Korea passed the examination for screening the history textbook for high school written by the Society of Contemporary History sponsored by core elements of conservative forces. 
					
					 The Society of Contemporary History is a vicious and conservative organization which proposed changing the expression "democracy" into "liberal democracy" in the teaching program in 2011. 
					
					 The chairman for textbooks of the society, in  particular, talked nonsense at the Ministry of Education, Science and Technology that the Japanese imperialists played a positive role in the modernization of Korea during their occupation of it and called for admitting this and specifying it in the history teaching program. His remarks sparked public furor. 
					
					 The Committee for Compiling the National History and the minister of Education, Science and Technology echoed the assertion of the conservative group without having any public discussion, causing uproar. 
					
					 During the Lee Myung Bak regime the conservative group came out with an alternative textbook which distorted the modern and contemporary history of south Korea in a bid to tamper with history. 
					
					 The present south Korean regime has carried forward the conservative nature of the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors. Under its patronage riff-ruffs of the above-said society are going reckless as if they had been waiting for this opportunity. They claim that the history textbooks published by other publishing houses have such a problem as a leftist tendency. This assertion is echoed by such reptile media as Chosun Ilbo. 
					
					 By doing so, the present ruling quarters of south Korea once again revealed before the nation their true colors as traitors putting the preceding regime into the shade.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised in Foreign Countries
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised in Foreign Countries
						
 Pyongyang, June 2 (KCNA) -- Diverse events were held in different countries on the occasion of the 49th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 They included a seminar and film show in Russia, a lecture in Brazil and a film show in Germany on May 22 and 23.
					
					 The participants in the film show watched "Fireworks for a Thriving Nation" and other Korean films.
					
					 Mishkin, chairman of the Nakhodka Regional Committee of Just Russia, said the DPRK has turned into a political and military power with tremendous military muscle under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The DPRK's Songun politics is the most just political mode that reliably protects the sovereignty and dignity of the country, he said, and went on:
					
					 The dear respected Kim Jong Un is faithfully carrying forward the cause of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Aleksandr Neves Rosendo da Silva, chairman of the Brazilian Center for the Study of the Juche Idea, praised Kim Jong Il for glorifying the Juche idea, the revolutionary idea of Kim Il Sung, as the eternal guiding idea for the era of independence and laying an eternal foundation of socialist Korea through his tireless patriotic devotion.
					
					 He extended firm solidarity to the Korean people in their struggle for building a thriving nation, defending sovereignty and reunifying the country.

articles.title: Uruguayan Newspaper Hails DPRK's New Strategic Line
articles.content:
Uruguayan Newspaper Hails DPRK's New Strategic Line 
						
 Pyongyang, June 2 (KCNA) -- The May 24 issue of the Uruguayan newspaper La Juventud carried an article titled "DPRK and its new strategic line" illustrated with a photo of the dear respected Kim Jong Un addressing the March, 2013 Plenary Meeting of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea. 
					 The article noted that the line on simultaneously pushing forward economic construction and the building of nuclear force was laid down at the plenary meeting.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 The new strategic line is the most realistic one suited to the specific conditions of the DPRK which aims at building a thriving socialist nation.
					
					 The Korean people have faced a lot of difficulties and bottlenecks in economic construction for decades.
					
					 It was because the DPRK has diverted huge human and material resources which should be used for the economic development and improvement of the people's living to the purpose of bolstering the nation's defense capability due to the persistent sanctions and pressure and aggressive moves of the hostile forces including the U.S.
					
					 Now that the DPRK has powerful nuclear deterrent for self-defence, its people have become able to step up the building of an economic power under more stable conditions.
					
					 Gone are the days never to return when the U.S. could threaten the DPRK with nukes and obstruct its economic construction.
					
					 The new strategic line of the DPRK helps bolster the country's military power with less spending and make a big investment in the building of an economic power.

articles.title: Indian President Receives New DPRK Ambassador
articles.content:
Indian President Receives New DPRK Ambassador 
						
 Pyongyang, June 2 (KCNA) -- Indian President Pranab Mukherjee received credentials from Pak Kyong Son, DPRK ambassador to the country, on May 28.
					 At the meeting the president said that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries have a long historical tradition and that India is attaching importance to developing the relations with the DPRK.
					
					 I am pleased that the friendly and cooperative ties between the two countries have recently developed on good terms, he noted.
					
					 He expressed belief that these relations would grow stronger in various fields in the future.
					
					 He stressed that India is paying deep attention to the development of the situation on the Korean Peninsula and has maintained its consistent stand that the tension in the region and the issue of Korean reunification should be settled through dialogue and negotiations.
					
					 He hoped the government and people of the DPRK would register greater successes in their efforts to develop the country's economy and improve the people's living standard.

articles.title: DPRK Praised by Bangladeshi President
articles.content:
DPRK Praised by Bangladeshi President
						
 Pyongyang, June 2 (KCNA) -- Abdul Hamid, president of Bangladesh, received credentials from Ri Song Hyon, DPRK ambassador to the country, on May 28.
					 The president recalled that President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il attached importance to the development of the relations between the two countries.
					
					 It is only the DPRK that stands up against the arbitrary practices of big powers at present, he noted, adding that the world admires the DPRK which is tiding over the crisis while taking toughest measures and applying dexterous diplomatic art under the leadership of supreme leader Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 He hoped that the DPRK would seek a negotiated settlement of the nuclear issue and the issues of the relations between Washington and Pyongyang and inter-Korean relations.
